reference_no_of_permission_being_relied_: Following the approval of application PP/2015/3928 to vary the conditions attached to P/2012/5040, a Non-Material Amendment (NMA) application 164558NMA was submitted . There have been two LBC (164468LBC and 185764LBC) which have now both expired.
decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date on which the consent is granted.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 18 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended, to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun.
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s):
Plans
Documents

Heritage Statement prepared by Turley, Design and Access Statement prepared by Hester Architect (February 2023), 189182 Asbestos R&D Report - North House, North House Historic Building Record 090916, 1831 North House Roof Structure Report,  1831 SK02-SK05 Roof Structure, 3249-1 Heating Options, Material Data Sheets - Brochure Glendyne Natural Slate, Material Data Sheets - London Mixed Stock Bricks - Windsor Reclamation,  Material Data Sheets - Scotch Buff Datasheet, Material Data Sheets - Slimline Secondary Double Glazing Sash Windows, Material Data Sheets - DS-221-AA

| Suitable precautions shall be undertaken to secure and protect all interior and exterior elements against accidental loss or damage during building work and no such elements shall be disturbed or removed temporarily or permanently except as indicated on the approved drawings or with the prior written approval of the local planning authority.

Reason: To protect the architectural and historic fabric of this Listed Building, in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2023).

| Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To protect the architectural and historic fabric of this Listed Building, in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2023).

|  Prior to commencement of the development, a Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, unless otherwise agreed in writing. Details shall include control measures for:
o	Noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
o	Dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
o	Lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
o	Delivery locations,
o	Hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays and 0800 -1300 Saturdays (except no work on public holidays),
o	Neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties
o	Public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works,
o	Details of site security, temporary lighting and the erection and maintenance of security hoarding including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing, where appropriate,

o	Vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how construction vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear and including details of any temporary vehicle access points,
o	Details as to the location(s) for storage of materials, plant and construction debris and contractors' welfare facilities and offices,
o	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from members of the public,
o	Measures to consult cyclists, disabled people and the local schools with regard to delivery times and necessary diversions, NA - sites are within a housing estate not obstructing any traffic
o	A commitment to be part of Considerate Constructors Scheme, and
o	Confirmation of use of TfL's Freight Operator Recognition Scheme (FORS) or similar.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site and that the functioning and safety of the highway network is not compromised, in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD and policies T3, T4 and D14 of the London Plan (2021).

| Prior to commencement of the proposed work, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, demonstrating that any changes to the building envelope will not reduce the acoustic performance of the existing building, i.e. is of equal or greater acoustic performance compared to the existing. Details shall demonstrate that work does not compromise standards of the Council's SPG10 and criteria of BS8233:2014 for dwellings. Approved details shall be implemented accordingly and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies  1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Policy D14 of the London Plan and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedroom above/below/adjoining kitchen/living/dining/bathroom of separate dwelling and adjoining the communal staircase. The assessment and mitigation measures shall have regard to standards of the Council's SPG10 and noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with the London Housing SPG, Policy D14 of the London Plan and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD. | The brickwork, bonding and mortar proposed in respect of the repair, repointing or reconstruction of the elevations as approved by this application shall match those used in the existing building unless otherwise approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: To protect the architectural and historic fabric of this Listed Building, in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2023).
description: Internal and external alterations to North House comprising roof & chimney repair works, repair of the building fabric, asbestos removal, replacement windows and doors, insulation of the building fabric, replacement rainwater goods, alterations to the internal layout and new mechanical and electrical services. (Listed Building Consent)
